duck: Shangri-La is a fictional valley in the 1933 novel Lost Horizon by James Hilton.
The Wraith: Shangri-La, a 2002 album by Insane Clown Posse
The Shangri-Las, an American girl group of the 1960s
A distant and secluded hideaway, usually of great beauty and peacefulness.

milestones: World's defense chiefs meet in Singapore

wiki.text:
{{Infobox fictional location
| name = Shangri-La colour = #C0C0C0 image = imagesize = 250px caption = source
| = [[Lost Horizon (novel)|Lost Horizon]] creator = James Hilton genre = Novel
| type = Valley locations = people =
}} <!-- Image with inadequate rationale removed: ''.]] --> 'Shangri-La' is a
fictional place described in the 1933 novel [[Lost Horizon]] by British author
James Hilton. Hilton describes Shangri-La as a mystical, harmonious valley,
gently guided from a lamasery, enclosed in the western end of the Kunlun
Mountains. Shangri-La has become synonymous with any earthly paradise, and
particularly a mythical Himalayan utopia — a permanently happy land, isolated
from the outside world. In the novel Lost Horizon, the people who live at Shangri-
La are almost immortal, living years beyond the normal lifespan and only very
slowly aging in appearance. The word also evokes the imagery of exoticism of
the Orient. In the ancient Tibetan scriptures, existence of seven such places
is mentioned as Nghe-Beyul Khimpalung.<ref name="National Park
brochure">{{cite book
  | last = Shrestha | first = Dr. Tirtha Bahadur coauthors = Joshi, Rabindra Man
  | and Sangam, Khagendra title = The Makalu-Barun National Park & Buffer Zone
  | Brochure publisher = Makalu-Barun National Park | year = July 2009
}}</ref> Khembalung is one of several [[beyul]]s ("hidden lands" similar to
Shangri-La) believed to have been created by Padmasambhava in the 8th century
as idyllic, sacred places of refuge for Buddhists during times of strife
(Reinhard 1978).

Many scholars believe that Shangri-La is Shambhala, a mythical kingdom in
Tibetan Buddhist tradition, which was sought by Eastern and Western
explorers.<ref name="ShambhalaFacinating"></ref>
wiki.title: Shangri-La
